prompt:
Caption: there is a woman that is sitting at a table with some tools.
Body part: upper arm. Risk factors: moderately above shoulder level (increased strain on shoulder joint).
Body part: neck. Risk factors: side-bent (causing muscle imbalance; fatigue).
Body part: trunk. Risk factors: bent forward 20 to 60 degrees (causing increased spinal loading).
Caption: there is a man that is sitting at a table with a coffee maker.
Body part: lower arm. Risk factors: too extended or overly flexed (fatigue if sustained).
Body part: legs. Risk factors: standing on one leg (asymmetric load on lower body).
Caption: there is a man that is sitting at a table with tools on it.
output: A man is seated at a table with some tools, where his upper arm is positioned moderately above shoulder level, increasing strain on the shoulder joint. His neck is side-bent, leading to muscle imbalance and fatigue, while his trunk is bent forward between 20 and 60 degrees, causing increased spinal loading. Furthermore, his lower arm appears too extended or overly flexed, which can result in fatigue if maintained for prolonged periods. Additionally, he is standing on one leg, creating an asymmetric load on the lower body.
